summary: The Indigenous Diplomacy and Engagement Act aims to establish an Office for Indigenous Affairs within the Department of State. This office, headed by a Coordinator for Indigenous Affairs, will coordinate federal efforts related to diplomacy and engagement with international Indigenous peoples. The bill mandates a comprehensive international strategy to promote engagement, involving assessments of countries with significant Indigenous populations, and a plan for activities in cooperation with these countries. Additionally, the legislation establishes an Advisory Commission on Indigenous Peoples and mandates training on Indigenous communities for foreign service officers. The bill authorizes appropriations to support the office and requires annual reports.
